data.title: Enrollment Advisors
data.meta_description: Your path to Gannon starts here! Reach out to your dedicated enrollment advisor for expert guidance in your admissions process.
data.text:
Dawn Casler

Regional Recruiter

Phone: 814-722-1936

Text: 814-546-3433

Email: casler002@gannon.edu

"I earned my Bachelor of Arts degree from Ohio Northern University and my Master in Science degree from University of Dayton. I’m married and enjoy summer living on Lake Erie as well as the practice of Bikram Yoga. My favorite thing about Gannon is the urban location that will supplement your classroom experience by learning how to apply your education to real world challenges. A piece of advice from Mother Teresa, “Give the world the best you have, and it may never be enough. GIVE THE BEST YOU’VE GOT ANYWAY”."

Areas of Focus

Region/Specialty

Central and Western Ohio: Adams, Allen, Athens, Auglaize, Brown, Butler, Champaign, Clark, Clermont, Clinton, Coshocton, Crawford, Darke, Defiance, Delaware, Erie, Fairfield, Fayette, Franklin, Fulton, Gallia, Greene, Hamilton , Hancock, Hardin, Henry, Highland, Holmes, Huron, Jackson, Jackson, Knox, Lawrence, Licking, Logan, Logan, Lucas, Madison, Marion, Meigs, Mercer, Miami, Montgomery, Morgan, Morrow, Muskingum, Ottawa, Paulding, Perry, Pickaway, Pike, Pike, Preble, Putnam, Richland, Ross, Sandusky, Scioto, Seneca, Shelby, Union, Van Wert, Vinton, Vinton, Warren, , Wood, Wyandot

States

Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Minnesota, Ohio, Wisconsin

Hayden Divers

Admissions Counselor

Phone: 814-871-7409

Text: 814-463-2419

Email: divers001@gannon.edu

"My name is Hayden, and I graduated from York College of Pennsylvania in May of 2021 with a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology and a minor in Spanish! I am originally from Central Pennsylvania, and I moved here to Erie right after college. During my undergraduate years, I was a member of our NCAA women's track and field team as a discus and shot-put thrower. I was also a Student Ambassador, Orientation Leader, Orientation Coordinator, First-Year Seminar Student Fellow, and had the privilege of studying abroad in Madrid, Spain, during my time at YCP. In my free time, I enjoy hiking, playing basketball, and spoiling my dog, Bailey. "

Areas of Focus

Region/Specialty

Northcentral and Northeast Pennsylvania: Bradford, Cameron, Centre, Clarion, Clearfield, Clinton, Elk, Forest, Jefferson, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Lycoming, McKean, Monroe, Pike, Potter, Sullivan, Susquehanna, Tioga, Warren, Wayne, Wyoming

Southern New York: Allegany, Cattaraugus, Chautauqua, Steuben

States

Pennsylvania, New Jersey, New York

Carly Hammer

Associate Director

Phone: 814-871-7341

Text: 814-821-2661

Email: hammer010@gannon.edu

"Born and raised in Erie, PA. My undergraduate degree is in Journalism with a minor in Public Relations Branding and Imaging. I was fortunate to study and live abroad in Scotland which would later spark a love for international travel. In my free time, when I am not planning another trip overseas, I love being with family, friends, and my dog. In the summers I like to take advantage of Presque Isle State Park where I kayak in the lagoons and boat in Lake Erie. Gannon’s campus is centrally located to all the best that the city has to offer and there is truly something for everyone here. As the saying goes, “It’s Okay to Love Erie!”"

Areas of Focus

Region/Specialty

Cyber and Engineering Recruitment

States

N/A

Lauren Kraynik

Senior Admissions Counselor

Phone: 814-871-7411

Text: 814-821-2641

Email: kraynik001@gannon.edu

"When I chose Gannon for my undergraduate education, one of my favorite things was the location. I love downtown Erie! It is a great size city, with so much to do! Outside of the office I love spending time with my husband and two young sons. When looking at colleges, my best piece of advice would be to visit, and ultimately choose the school where you feel most comfortable."

Areas of Focus

Nathan Kujan

Admissions Counselor

Phone: 814-871-7751

Text: 814-527-3296

Email: kujan001@gannon.edu

"I am a recent graduate of Capital University with my Bachelors of Arts in Exercise Science. The first thing I noticed about Gannon is how welcoming the campus is. The moment you step onto campus you are invited to be involved in the community, especially through the many clubs or organizations that are on campus. Ask me about anything Disney or sports related and I probably know the answer. Some other hobbies that I have include collecting many different Disney and Star Wars Vinylmations. Of which I have about 50. One piece of advice I tell people about picking a college is to find the one that you can see yourself at for the next 4 years."

Areas of Focus

Region/Specialty

Northwest New York: Cayuga, Cortland, Erie, Genesee, Livingston, Monroe, Niagara, Onondaga, Ontario, Orleans, Oswego, Schuyler, Seneca, Tompkins, Wayne, Wyoming, Yates

States

New York

Julie Lapiska

Associate Director

Phone: 814-871-7410

Text: 814-527-3375

Email: lapiska003@gannon.edu

"I'm originally from Saint Marys, PA, but have never left Erie after proudly graduating from Gannon. Most of my time away from work is spent with my husband and two young boys. My favorite hobby is definitely running. When I can, I'll run at Presque Isle State Park, my favorite place in Erie. Not surprisingly, my favorite place on campus is the Health and Wellness Center - especially in the winters! I love to listen to music and if want to know something unique about me, it's that I like to eat Doritos and peanut butter sandwiches. My advice to all students is to follow your heart!"

Areas of Focus

Region/Specialty

Erie, Pennsylvania: Dual Enrollment and Catholic High Schools

States

Pennsylvania

Kara Morgan

Associate Director

Phone: 814-871-7755

Text: 814-527-3320

Email: morgan013@gannon.edu

"My Bachelor of Arts degree is from Penn State University, but I am also a proud Gannon alum with a Masters degree in Public Administration. I’ve worked in a few offices at Gannon, including Graduate Admissions and Registrars, and now, I’m happy to be a part of the Office of Admissions. My favorite thing about Gannon is the sense of community that you feel as soon as you step on campus. Be sure to visit any college that you’re considering, walk around, talk to people, and choose the one that feels right!"

Areas of Focus

Region/Specialty

Northeast Ohio: Ashland, Ashtabula, Belmont, Carroll, Columbiana, Cuyahoga, Geauga, Guernsey, Harrison, Jefferson, Lake, Lorain, Mahoning, Medina, Monroe, Noble, Portage, Stark, Summit, Trumbull, Tuscarawas, Washington, Wayne

Central and Eastern New York: Albany, Bronx, Broome, Chemung, Chenango, Clinton, Columbia, Delaware, Dutchess, Essex, Franklin, Fulton, Greene, Hamilton, Herkimer, Jefferson, Kings, Lewis, Madison, Montgomery, Nassau, New York, Oneida, Orange, Otsego, Putnam, Queens, Rensselaer, Richmond, Rockland, Saratoga, Schenectady, Schoharie, St. Lawrence, Suffolk, Sullivan, Tioga, Ulster, Warren, Washington, Westchester

States

Alabama, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, Maine, Massachusetts, Mississippi, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Rhode Island, South Carolina, Tennessee, Vermont, West Virginia

Lauren Theisen

Associate Director

Phone: 814-871-5563

Text: 814-527-3267

Email: theisen008@gannon.edu

"I am a proud Gannon University graduate and I love the sense of community and family that Gannon offers. I also love the Erie area, and when I am not at work, my family and I enjoy taking in all that the city has to offer. If you are considering Gannon, please come visit the campus and talk to the students, staff and faculty so you can have a better idea of what being a student at Gannon University is like."

Areas of Focus

Region/Specialty

Erie, Pennsylvania: Non-Dual Enrollment, Transfer and Adult students

States

Pennsylvania

Miles Vida

Associate Director

Phone: 814-871-5850

Text: 814-821-2664

Email: vida002@gannon.edu

"I am originally from the scenic and majestic town of Wakeman, Ohio. As an Ohio native now living in Erie, PA, I keep true to my roots by supporting both the Browns and the Guardians. In addition to being a team member in the Office of Admissions, I am a GU alum with a Master's Degree from the School of Education and I coach the men's club volleyball teams. I am a member of several higher education professional organizations and spend my free time watching Doctor Who, playing volleyball/golf and attempting to turn my Delorean into a time machine. My favorite things about Gannon are the friendly/helpful people who comprise the campus community and the newly renovated Nash Library. My favorite movies are The Empire Strikes Back and Ghostbusters, my favorite book is Ready Player One and my favorite quote comes from Dr. Robert Doback “Don’t lose your dinosaur”. My piece of advice for prospective students is to visit campus and try to interact with as many people as possible as you explore the opportunities that are available."

Areas of Focus

Region/Specialty

Southwest Pennsylvania: Allegheny, Fayette, Greene, Somerset, Washington

States

Pennsylvania

Micki Webster

Admissions Counselor

Phone: 814-871-5759

Text: 814-524-3193

Email: webster010@gannon.edu

"I am originally from the Pittsburgh area and graduated from Bethany College in May of 2022 with a bachelor’s degree in Political Science. In college I was a Student Ambassador and absolutely loved giving tours to prospective students and their families. I was also involved in competitive swimming, Greek life, and many other clubs and organizations on campus. I enjoy the Erie area so much that prior to graduation I decided to move here and continue my passion of helping students navigate the college search process. Outside of work I enjoy painting, reading, and cooking. My advice to students when choosing a college is that this is a big choice pertaining mostly to you, so choose a place where you feel the most at home. Go Knights!"

Areas of Focus

Region/Specialty

Southwest Central Pennsylvania: Armstrong, Beaver, Blair, Butler, Cambria, Indiana, Lawrence, Westmoreland

States

Pennsylvania
